qas.question: What is the usual form for Neiserria bacteria?
What well known bacteria structure chains?
What does typically Staphylococcus look like?
What type of bacteria is surrounded by a capsule?
Formation of what can be related to fungal mycelia?

context: Many bacterial species exist simply as single cells, others associate in characteristic patterns: Neisseria form <a0_0>diploids (pairs)<a0_0/>, <a1_0>Streptococcus<a1_0/> form chains, and Staphylococcus group together in "bunch of grapes" <a2_0>clusters<a2_0/>. Bacteria can also be elongated to form filaments, for example the Actinobacteria. <a3_0>Filamentous bacteria<a3_0/> are often surrounded by a sheath that contains many individual cells. Certain types, such as species of the genus Nocardia, even form complex, <a4_0>branched filaments<a4_0/>, similar in appearance to fungal mycelia.
